page.title: 04Education in Costessey
page.content: The former village elementary school is now Saint Augustine's Roman Catholic Primary School. A new school was built on Beaumont Road in the 1930s: this is now Costessey Infant School. An imposing site overlooking the A47 was chosen for Costessey Junior School, in the early 1950s. At its peak, it had over 500 pupils, but has now stabilised in the 300+ range. The former Secondary Modern School is now Costessey High School, dealing with children aged 11 to 16. Pupils transfer to the City College or a comprehensive school in the city for Sixth Form. Costessey is unusual in retaining transfer at 11+ rather than 12+ like the city middle schools do.
